segment.source: You need to sign a mobile image before you can deploy it to a device.
segment.target: You need to sign a mobile image before you can deploy it to a device.

segment.source: Sign a mobile image
segment.target: Sign a mobile image

segment.source: Sign a mobile image
segment.target: Sign a mobile image

segment.source: You need to sign a mobile image before you can deploy it to a device.
segment.target: You need to sign a mobile image before you can deploy it to a device.

segment.source: For more information about signing images, see Sign a full flash update (FFU) image.
segment.target: For more information about signing images, see Sign a full flash update (FFU) image.

segment.source: Before you start, make sure you followed the steps in Step 5: Install OEM test certs in Prepare for Windows mobile development.
segment.target: Before you start, make sure you followed the steps in Step 5: Install OEM test certs in Prepare for Windows mobile development.

segment.source: If you haven't done this yet, do this first before proceeding with the steps for signing an image.
segment.target: If you haven't done this yet, do this first before proceeding with the steps for signing an image.

segment.source: In this walkthrough, we'll focus on test signing the image manually.
segment.target: In this walkthrough, we'll focus on test signing the image manually.

segment.source: In addition to ImageSigner, we'll also use Sign.cmd.
segment.target: In addition to ImageSigner, we'll also use Sign.cmd.

segment.source: To test sign an image
segment.target: To test sign an image

segment.source: Open a developer prompt with administrator rights in the directory that contains the output from the image generation process.
segment.target: Open a developer prompt with administrator rights in the directory that contains the output from the image generation process.

segment.source: Extract the catalog of the unsigned FFU file by running the following command:
segment.target: Extract the catalog of the unsigned FFU file by running the following command:

segment.source: ImageSigner GETCATALOG TestFlash.ffu TestFlash.cat
segment.target: ImageSigner GETCATALOG TestFlash.ffu TestFlash.cat

segment.source: Sign the catalog using the /pk option.
segment.target: Sign the catalog using the /pk option.

segment.source: There are two parts to this step:
segment.target: There are two parts to this step:

segment.source: Set SIGNOEM=1
segment.target: Set SIGNOEM=1

segment.source: Sign.cmd /pk TestFlash.cat
segment.target: Sign.cmd /pk TestFlash.cat

segment.source: Sign the FFU with the signed catalog file using ImageSigner.
segment.target: Sign the FFU with the signed catalog file using ImageSigner.

segment.source: ImageSigner SIGN TestFlash.ffu TestFlash.cat
segment.target: ImageSigner SIGN TestFlash.ffu TestFlash.cat

segment.source: Once the image is signed, you're ready to flash the image to your mobile device.
segment.target: Once the image is signed, you're ready to flash the image to your mobile device.
